All rights reserved.</copyright><image><title>The Telegraph: Calcutta</title><url>http://www.telegraphindia.com/images/logo_small.gif</url><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com</link></image><item><title>Centre mulls ordinance to bypass NEET</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85379.jsp</link><description>The Centre is exploring the possibility of bringing an ordinance to bypass the Supreme Court ruling that has made the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) mandatory for students seeking admission into MBBS and BDS courses anywhere in the country.</description></item><item><title>Sadhus clash at Simhastha</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85376.jsp</link><description>Two groups of sadhus fought pitched battles at the Simhastha kumbh in Ujjain today after a dispute over polls to a religious post.</description></item><item><title>4 Indian cities among most polluted ten</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85378.jsp</link><description>Gwalior has been listed as the world's second worst polluted city measured through air quality by a World Health Organisation report released today that has called on governments to treat improving air quality as a top health and development priority.</description></item><item><title>Bhushan chopper salvo at Raman</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85380.jsp</link><description>Swaraj Abhiyan leader Prashant Bhushan today accused the Raman Singh-led BJP government in Chhattisgarh of irregularities in procuring an AgustaWestland helicopter in 2007 and dared the Narendra Modi government to probe the deal.</description></item><item><title>Proposal to reverse brain death shocks doctors</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85381.jsp</link><description>A proposal by an Indian spine surgeon to try and revive patients declared brain dead has surprised the medical community and India's health research agency, who believe that brain death is irreversible.</description></item><item><title>Arrears stall CISF cover for airports</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85377.jsp</link><description>More than a quarter of India's airports do not have specialised CISF security because the Airports Authority of India has delayed payments to the paramilitary force, the Centre has told Parliament.</description></item><item><title>Railways send water bill to Latur</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85340.jsp</link><description>The railways have sent a Rs 4-crore bill to the collector of Latur as transportation charge for water trains sent to the drought-hit district in Maharashtra.</description></item><item><title>Cong to take on Swamy for 'dangerous lies'</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85375.jsp</link><description>The Congress has decided to move a breach of privilege motion against Subramanian Swamy in the Rajya Sabha tomorrow for misleading the nation on the AgustaWestland scam with his "dangerous lies."</description></item><item><title>Modi, Chandy spar on Libya rescue</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85374.jsp</link><description>The Narendra Modi government and Kerala chief minister Oommen Chandy today yanked Indians who had escaped bullets and bombs in civil wars abroad into political crossfire ahead of state polls, each claiming credit for rescuing the evacuees.</description></item><item><title>Recalled envoy sees 'wrong message'</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85373.jsp</link><description>The decision by Kathmandu to recall him suddenly has sent a "wrong message," but India needs to stay large-hearted in dealing with Nepal, the country's outgoing ambassador has said, suggesting both sides share responsibility for fresh tensions that threaten ties.</description></item><item><title>Left banks on Kerala cleric</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85372.jsp</link><description>The CPM-led Left Democratic Front is banking on an unlikely saviour in this northernmost Kerala constituency where it is locked in a three-cornered fight with the BJP and the Muslim League. A cleric who was recently in the news for his anti-women utterances.</description></item><item><title>FB and political hand help A+ students</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85371.jsp</link><description>On a day when Malayalis were venting ire on social media over Prime Minister Narendra Modi likening Kerala to Somalia, another Facebook community brought a smile to a family of four in a hamlet here.</description></item><item><title>Letter on judges daredevilry: SC</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160513/jsp/nation/story_85370.jsp</link><description>The Supreme Court has likened to "daredevilry" the circulation of a letter in the Bar saying two sitting judges of Gujarat High Court owed their allegiance to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and BJP chief Amit Shah and not to the Constitution.</description></item></channel></rss>
